imr.matrix

Class Matrix

  • java.lang.Object
    • imr.matrix.Matrix

  • public final class Matrix
extends java.lang.Object
    The Matrix class defines methods to perform the most common operations applied to matrices. In addition, you can print the content of a matrix, load a matrix from a file and store the content of a matrix into a file.

    • Constructor Summary

      Makes a new instance of a Matrix object and initializes it to have r rows and c columns.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Matrix

        public Matrix(int r,
              int c)
        Makes a new instance of a Matrix object and initializes it to have r rows and c columns.
        Parameters:
        r - number of rows.
        c - number of columns. All the positions in the matrix are set to zero.

      • Matrix

        public Matrix(java.lang.String fileName)
        Makes a new instance of a Matrix object.
        Parameters:
        fileName - a well formatted file containing information to load. The matrix is initialized according to the content of the file.

        The file has to have the following format: 

         #rows #columns
c0,0 c0,1 c0,2...c0,n
c1,0 c1,1 c1,2...c1,n
c2,0 c2,1 c2,2...c2,n
.
.
.
cm,0 cm,1 cm,2...cm,n

        Example.

        File formatted to store a 3x3 matrix: 

         3 3
 1 0 2
 5 3 7
 4 1 1

    • Method Detail

      • print

        public void print()
        Shows the contents of a matrix.

      • load

        public void load(java.lang.String fileName)
        Loads from a file.
        Parameters:
        fileName - a well formatted file. Fills the matrix according to the information stored in the file passed as parameter.

        To know how such a file is formatted see the constructor's section.

      • store

        public void store(java.lang.String fileName)
        Stores the contents of a matrix into a file.
        Parameters:
        fileName - a file name. To know how such a file is formatted see the constructor's section.

      • rows

        public int rows()
        Returns the number of rows in the matrix.
        Returns:
        number of rows.

      • columns

        public int columns()
        Returns the number of columns in the matrix.
        Returns:
        the number of columns.

      • get

        public double get(int i,
                  int j)
        Gets a value from the matrix.
        Parameters:
        i - row index.
        j - colum index.
        Returns:
        the value stored in M(i,j).

      • set

        public void set(int i,
                int j,
                double value)
        stores a value into a matrix.
        Parameters:
        i - row index.
        j - column index.
        value - a value to store.

      • get

        public Matrix get(int fromRow,
                  int toRow,
                  int fromCol,
                  int toCol)
        Gets a chunk from a matrix.
        Parameters:
        fromRow - first row.
        toRow - last row.
        fromCol - first column.
        toCol - last column.
        Returns:
        a matrix containing the requested chunk as content.

        Example:

        If you hav a matrix A, and want to get a chunk from row 0 to row 1 and from column 0 to column 1. 

         Matrix chunk = A.get(0,1,0,1);

      • resize

        public void resize(int r,
                   int c)
        Resizes the matrix to the number of rows and columns passed as parameter.
        Parameters:
        r - number of rows.
        c - number of columns.

      • resizeRows

        Parameters:

      • resizeColumns

        public void resizeColumns(int c)
        Resizes only the columns of a matrix.
        Parameters:
        c - number of columns.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Matrix m)
        Evaluates if a matrix is equal as the one passed as parameter.
        Parameters:
        m - a matrix to be compared.
        Returns:
        true if equal or false otherwise.

        public java.lang.Object clone()
        Makes a clone of a matrix.
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the cloned matrix. You must cast to Matrix. 

         Matrix clonedMatrix = (Matrix)m.clone();

        public Matrix inverse()
        Gets the inverse of a matrix. B = A^-1.

        the transposed matrix.

      • add

        public static Matrix add(Matrix m1,
                         Matrix m2)
        Gets a matrix resulting of adding the matrices passed as parameters. C = A+B.
        Parameters:
        m1 - first matrix.
        m2 - second matrix.
        Returns:
        m1+m2.

        Gets a matrix result of substract the matrices passed as parameters. C = A-B.
        Parameters:

        m2 - second matrix.
        Returns:
        m1-m2.

        m2 - second matrix.
        Returns:

                         double value)

        value -
        Returns:

      • rotation

        public static Matrix rotation(double x,
                              double y,
                              double z,
                              double w)
        Eulers's rotation matrix.
        Parameters:
        x - the x component.
        y - the y component.
        z - the z component.
        w - angle.
        Returns:
        a rotation matrix. x, y and z are the components of a vector and w is the rotation angle.
